Title: Armor
Dialogue: It's just prop armor from a Renaissance fair, but it's still metal.
Description: Any time (not just once per turn) you take physical damage, take 1 less point of damage. This item can't be stolen.

Title: Puzzle Box
Dialogue: There must be a way to open it.
Description: Once during your turn, you can attempt a Knowledge roll to open the box: 6+ You open the box. Draw 2 item cards and discard the Puzzle Box. 0-5 You just can't get it open.

Title: Angel Feather
Dialogue: A perfect feather fluttering in your hand.
Description: When you attempt a roll of any kind, you can call out a number from 0 to 8. Use that number instead of rolling the dice. Discard this item after you use it.

Title: Music Box
Dialogue: A hand-crafted antique. It plays a haunting melody that gets stuck in your head.
Description: Once per turn, you can open or close the Music Box. While the Music Box is open, any explorer or monster with a Sanity trait that enters or starts its turn in the same room must make a Sanity rool of 4+. If the roll fails, the explorer or monster ends its turn as it is mesmerized by the music. If an explorer or monster carrying the Music Box is mesmerized, it drops the Music Box. If the Music Box is open when it is dropped, it remains open.

Title: Dark Dice
Dialogue: Are you feeling lucky?
Description: Once per turn, you can roll 3 dice: 6: Move to the location of any explorer not revealed as a traitor. 5 Move one other explorer in the same room into an adjacent room. 4 Gain 1 in a physical trait. 3 Immediately move into an adjacent room (no movement cost). 2 Gain 1 in a mental trait. 1 Draw an event card. 0 Reduce all of your traits to the lowest value above the skull symbol. Discard the Dark Dice.

Title: Rabbit's Foot
Dialogue: Not so lucky for the rabbit.
Description: Once during your turn, you can reroll 1 die. You must keep the second roll.

Title: Blood Dagger
Dialogue: WEAPON A nasty weapon. Needles and tubes extend from the handle… and plunge right into your veins.
Description: You roll 3 additional dice (maximum of 8 dice) when making a Might attack with this weapon. If you do, lose 1 Speed. You can't use another weapon while you're using this one. This item can't be traded or dropped. If it's stolen, take 2 dice of physical damage.

Title: Bottle
Dialogue: An opaque vial containing a black liquid.
Description: Once during your turn after the haunt is revealed, you can roll 3 dice and drink from the Bottle: 6 Choose a room and put your explorer there. 5 Gain 2 Might and 2 Speed. 4 Gain 2 Knowledge and 2 Sanity. 3 Gain 1 Knowledge and lose 1 Might. 2 Lose 2 Knowledge and 2 Sanity. 1 Lose 2 Might and 2 Speed. 0 Lose 2 from each trait. Discard this item after you use it.

Title: Lucky Stone
Dialogue: A smooth, ordinary-looking rock. You sense it will bring you good fortune.
Description: After you attemt a roll of any kind you can rub the stone once to reroll any number of those dice. Discard this item after you use it.

Title: Medical Kit
Dialogue: A doctor's bag, depleted in some critical resources.
Description: Once during your turn, you can attempt a Knowledge roll to heal yourself or another explorer in the same room: 8+ Gain up to 3 points of physical traits. 6-7 Gain up to 2 points of physical traits. 4-5 Gain 1 point in a physical trait. 0-3 Nothing happens. You can't raise a trait above its starting value with the Medical Kit.

Title: Healing Salve
Dialogue: A sticky paste in a shallow bowl.
Description: You can apply the Healing Salve to yourself or to another living explorer in the same room. If that explorer's Might or Speed is below its starting value, raise on or both traits to its starting value. Discard this item after you use it.

Title: The amulet of the Ages
Dialogue: Ancient silver and inlaid gems, inscribed with blessings.
Description: Gain 1 in each trait now. Lose 3 in each trait if you lose the Amulet.

Title: Dynamite
Dialogue: The fuse isn't lit… yet.
Description: Instead of attacking, you can throw the Dynamite through a connecting door into an adjacent room. Each explorer and monster with Might and Speed traits in that room must attempt a Speed roll: 5+ Take now damage from Dynamite. 0-4 Take 4 points of physical damage. Discard this item after you use it.

Title: Sacrificial Dagger
Dialogue: WEAPON A twisted shard of iron covered in mysterious symbols and stained with blood.
Description: When making a Might attack with this weapon, you roll 3 extra dice (maximum of 8 dice), but you must make a Knowledge roll first: 6+ No effect. 3-5 Lose 1 from a mental trait. 0-2 The dagger twists in your hand! Take 2 dice of physical damage. You can't attack this turn. You can't use another weapon while you're using this one.

Title: Axe
Dialogue: WEAPON Very sharp.
Description: You roll 1 additional die (maximum of 8 dice) when making a Might attack with this weapon. You can't use another weapon while you're using this one.

Title: Pickpoket's Gloves
Dialogue: Helpign yourself has never seemed so easy. When you are in the same room as another explorer, you can discard this item to take any item that explorer is carrying.

Title: Bell
Dialogue: A brass bell that makes a resonant clang.
Description: Gain 1 Sanity now. Lose 1 Sanity if you lose the Bell. Once during your turn after the haunt is revealed, you can attempt a Sanity roll to use the Bell: 5+ Mone any number of unimpeded heroes 1 space closer to you. 0-4 The traitor can move any number of monsters 1 space closer to you. (If you are the traitor, this result has no effect.) If there is no traitor, all monsters move 1 space closer to you.

Title: Revolver
Dialogue: WEAPON An old, potent-looking weapon.
Description: You can use the Revolver to attack with Speed instead of Might. (Your opponent then defends with Speed and takes physical damage.) Roll 1 additional die on your speed attack roll (maximum of 8 dice). With the Revolver, you can attack anyone in the same room or within line of sight (through uninterrupted straight line of doors). If you attack someone in another room and lose, you don't take damage. You can't use another weapon while you're using this one.

Title: Adrenaline Shot
Dialogue: A syringe containing a strange fluorescent liquid.
Description: Before you attempt a trait roll, you can use this item to add 4 to the result of that roll. Discard this item after you use it.

Title: Idol
Dialogue: Perhaps it's chosen you for some greater purpose. Like human sacrifice.
Description: Once per turn, you can rub the Idol before making any trait, combat, or event roll to add 2 dice to the roll (to a maximum of 8 dice). Each time you do, lose 1 Sanity.

Title: Smelling Salts
Dialogue: Whew, that's a lungful.
Description: If your or another living explorer's Knowledge is below its starting value, and you're in the same room, you cn raise that trait to its starting value by using the Smelling Salts. Discard this item after you use it.

Title: Candle
Dialogue: It makes the shadows move - at leas, you hope it's doing that.
Description: If you draw an event card, roll 1 additional die (maximum of 8 dice) for that event's trait rolls. If you have the Bell, Book, and Candle, gain 2 in each trait. The first time you lose one of those 3 items later in the game, lose 2 from each trait.
